= ದ್ವಿಜಾವಂತಿ.
a killing of a brāhmaṇa or brāhmaṇās.
a wound, scratch or tear made by biting with a tooth or teeth.
(mus.) a mode in Karnāṭaka system, derived from the main mode Harikāmbhōji.
having two tongues (as snakes).
making false promises or not acting as per one's own words.
a snake that has split tongue.
a man who lies and whose actions are different from his words.
a slanderer.
the gum obtained from the olibanum trees.
any of these trees.
= ದ್ವಿಟ್ಚಕ್ರ.
a multitude of enemies.
a set of two similar, corresponding, complementary persons, animals or things; a pair.
(arith.) the cardinal number two; 2.
coming next after the first in order of place or time; second; 2nd.
ದ್ವಿತೀಯ ವಯಸ್ಸು dvitīya vayassu the second half of one's life-period.
a friend or companion.
a thing that is different (from the one under reference).
(gram.) the accusative case.
a woman as related to a man to whom she is married; a wife.
the second day of a lunar fortnight.
(gram.) the accusative case.
a set of two similar, corresponding, complementary persons, animals or things; a pair.
(arith.) the cardinal number two; 2.
(gram.) a syllable formed by the combination of two consonants.
a word having one or more such clustered consonants.
(gram.) the usage of a word either with consonants combined or with a single consonant in its place.
(gram.) occurrence of a syllable formed by the combination of two consonants.
= ದ್ವಿದಳ1.
= ದ್ವಿದಳ2.
splitting or that can be split, into two parts.
a combination of two leaves, petals or pods.
a leguminous seed (as of pea nut, soybean seed, etc.) that can be easily split into two parts (unlike the grain of rice, wheat).

(yoga.) a mystical lotus flower, having two petals, one of the six such flowers in the body; (they are considered as six stages where the raised divine energy rests as it moves upwards to the crown of the head, and at each stage different mystical power is bestowed on the person).
a defect of the eye, that makes two images of an object be seen.
divided or dividing into two parts; dichotomously.
in two ways, manners.
that which is split, divided into two parts.
a moving, thinking, acting in two different ways or manners.
the quality of one's action being sharply opposed to what one has said or implied.
any of a class of animals (as frogs, crab, crocodile, etc.) that live both in the water and on the land.
the condition of having at the same time two feelings, that are contradictory to each other.
a conduct or behaviour characterised by contradictions (as between two kinds of emotions or between thought and emotion, speech and action, thought and action etc.).
an elephant that drinks water in two stages (first sucking into its trunk and next taking into the mouth).
a set of two wings (as of an aeroplane).
both the sides (of anything).
(pl.) two groups.
of, having or involving two sides, halves, factions, etc.; bilateral.
affecting both sides; reciprocal.
having or walking on two feet.
a two-legged animal (as a human being).
(gram.) two words.
(pros.) a kind of meter having three Viṣṇu gaṇas and one Brahma gaṇas in each line.
(pros.) a meter in which each verse has two lines.
(pros.) a meter in which each lines has three groups of five units and one group of three units.
a literary composition, mainly for singing, having independent verses each having two lines.
(yoga.) a standing on one's head keeping both the legs pointing upwards (the entire body being perpendicular to the floor).
a sum of money, which is double the prescribed amount, required to be paid as a punishment or penalty for an offence.
